section.title: Table of contents of Rambam's Kiddush HaChodesh
Law 1
section.para: Month is lunar; year is solar.

section.title: Law 2
section.para: Solar year is ~11 days longer than the lunar; when discrepancy accumulates to ~30 days, year is made leap.

section.title: Law 3
Laws 5-8
section.para: Court calculates in a manner _resembling_ the calculations of the astronomers.

section.title: Laws 1-2
Laws 3-8
section.para: Other reasons for leaping the year; (Succos after the autumnal equinox - not mentioned in Rambam.)

section.title: Laws 1-2
section.para: Introduction; discrepancy with observations: -1…+1 day (+1 - very rare).

section.title: Law 2
section.para: Fixed Rosh Hodesh: sighting of the Moon can be +/- 1 day; +2 - extremely rare.

section.title: Law 1
section.para: "Molad" - approximate conjunction (Sun. Moon and Earth on the same line).

section.title: Law 4
Law 5
section.para: Lunar month % 7 = 1d12h793p; lunar year % 7 = 4d8h876p; leap year % 7 = 5d21h589p.

section.title: Law 7
section.para: if molad Nisan - Sunday, 5h107p after sunrise, next month - Iyar: Tuesday night, 5h900p.

section.title: Law 8
section.para: First conjunction - Tishrei, year #1: Monday, 5h204p (just subtract % from the next one :)) Conjunction of Rosh Hashono of Adam's creation (year #2, see Shmita and Yovel 10:2): Friday, 6h.

section.title: Law 9
section.para: We do not need the number of days, just the remainders.

section.title: Law 10
section.para: 19 year cycle (12+7 leap); because the difference between 19 solar years and the cycle is less than a day: 1h485p.

section.title: Law 1
section.para: Rosh Hashono gets pushed off from Sunday, Wednesday, Friday.

section.title: Law 2
section.para: Gets pushed off if molad is after noon (Molad Zoken).

section.title: Law 3
section.para: ADU applies after noon push-off also.

section.title: Law 4
section.para: Non-leap year, if molad is at night of the 3rd day after 9h204p: push off to Thursday (or the year willbe too long).

section.title: Law 5
section.para: Year after leap one, Monday, after 5h589p: push to Tuesday.

section.title: Law 3
section.para: Nisan (Spring) - Aries; Tammuz - Cancer; Tishrei - Libra; Teves - Cap.? Vernal equinox of year #1 = 7d9h642p before conjunction of Nisan. Notes 5,7 in Moznaim edition. Every year seasons move 30h; in 28 years - in the same place.

section.title: Law 5
section.para: Vernal equinox, year 4930: midnight, 5th day, 8th of Nisan.

section.title: Law 7
section.para: Real seasons - 2 days before average ones. Note 5: 1st hour of the 4th day of creation; 1st vernal equinox. Autumnal: Wednesday, 3 hours after daybreak, 1d23h before conjunction of Tishrei.

section.title: Law 1
section.para: More precise length of a solar year. Moments.

section.title: Law 3
section.para: Vernal equinox of year #1 - 9h642p before conjunction of Nisan. (Differenbt from 9:3: Rav Ada follows Rabbi Yehoshua - world created in Nisan; Shmuel (9:3) follows Rabbi Eliezer - world created in Tishrei.) Every first year of the 19-year cycle.

section.title: Law 6
section.para: This more precise calculation of seasons was used by Sanhedrin to leap the year because of the spring equinox.

section.title: Law 7
section.para: Real vernal equinox approximately 2 days before either of these calculations.

section.title: Laws 1-4
section.para: Visibility calculations are deep. Fixed calendar can be appreciated even by school children in 3 or 4 days.

section.title: Laws 5-6
section.para: Calculations are simplified/approximated to not fluster the inexprerienced; result - visibility of the moon - is not affected.

section.title: Laws 7-9
section.para: 360 degrees; 60 minutes, seconds...; order of the 12 constellations.

section.title: Laws 13-14
section.para: Velocities are constant. Earth encircled by all the spheres but isn't in the center. Notes 14,15 in Moznaim.

section.title: Law 1
section.para: Movement of the Sun. Moznaim Note 6: calculations may be accurate only on the first day of the month; Note 7. 59′8.33″ Yale, p.99; Neugeb., p. 388ff

section.title: Law 2
section.para: Movement of the Sun's apogee. Moznaim Note 10: over 800 years, apogee moved ~12 degrees and is in constellation of Cancer. Note 11: position - at 6PM.

section.title: Law 1
section.para: Moon: epicycle and deferent; movement as seen from Earth. See Moznaim notes!

section.title: Law 5
section.para: Time of sighting correction table: ~20 minutes after sunset.
